required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy Evaluation of CD19-UCART
clinical_study.official_title: A Safety and Efficacy Study of CD19-UCART (Allogeneic Engineered T-cells Expressing Anti-CD19 Chimeric Antigen Receptor) in Patients With Relapsed or Refractory B-cell Hematologic Malignancies

collaborator.agency: The First Affiliated Hospital of Zhengzhou University
Second Xiangya Hospital of Central South University

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety and efficacy of ascending doses of CD19-UCART in patients with relapsed or refractory B-cell hematological malignancies.

detailed_description.textblock: CD19-UCART is a kind of "off-the-shelf" product originated from health donor's PBMC.This is a open-label, dose estilation study to evaluate the safety and anti-tumor efficacy of CD19-UCART in the treatment of relapsed or refractory B-cell hematological malignancies.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 35 days after T cell infusion
primary_outcome.description: Adverse events assessed according to NCI-CTCAE v4.03 criteria

secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of patients in whom a response among complete response and partial response as defined by standard disease-specific criteria, will be observed.
Duration of persistence of CD19-UCART cells after infusion will be detected by FACS or QPCR

arm_group.description: All patients will be treated with 1 injection of CD19-UCART. Three escalating dose-levels (0.5-1x10^6/kgBW, 1.5-3x10^6/kgBW, 4-5x10^6/kgBW) of CD19-UCART will be evaluated using a 3+3 design. Each CD19-UCART injection will be administered at Day 0.

intervention.description: A conditioning therapy with cyclophosphamide and fludarabine will be conducted before CD19-UCART injection.

overall_official.affiliation: First Affliated Hospital of Zhengzhou University

facility.name: First Affliated Hospital of Zhengzhou University
Second Xiangya Hospital of Central South University
